result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin R. Martin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kevin R. Martin is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kevin R. Martin was found guilty of 3rd Degree Sexual Assault [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).
  • Kevin R. Martin was found guilty of 4th Degree Sexual Assault [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Kenosha County Clerk of Circuit Court

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not have contact with victims including NGA or JKD, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  Participate and follow recommendations of sex offender treatment assessment, Drug & Alcohol Assessment, Mental Health Evaluation & participate in the creations of a realistic case plan and programming related to the associated goals and identified criminogenic needs.  Make payments for court obligations and supervision fees.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Denise Hertz-McGrath.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights notification and sentencing arguments are made.  
Count 1 - DE is sentenced to 5 years in the WSP; 1 year Initial Confinement followed by 4 years Extended Supervision concurrent with Count 3 and any other sentence.
Count 3 - DE is sentenced to 18 months in the WSP; 1 year Initial Confinement followed by 6 months Extended Supervision concurrent with Count 1 and any other sentence.
DE is given credit for 672 days.  DE is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.
Sentencing hearing at 09-03-2015 11:30 am
Sentencing time changed from 1:30 PM to 11:30 AM and confirmed with Atty Hertz-McGrath due to overlap with Behavioral Health Court.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Denise Hertz-McGrath.  Clerk: PT
Atty Hertz states she was not able to go over PSI with DE as he was not made available in the jail due to his late arrival.  Sentencing adj. to 9/3/15 at 1:30 PM.
Amended

11:10 a.m. - Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Denise Hertz-McGrath.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Amended Information filed.  Counts 2, 4, and 5 are dismissed on State motion.  Counts 1 and 3 - Pleas of guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Presentence investigation ordered.  Sentencing 7/24/15 at 11:00.  Bond continued.

8:45 a.m. - Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Denise Hertz-McGrath.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Case may be resolved.  Adj. to 11:00 today to allow the State time to file an Amended Information.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Denise Hertz-McGrath. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by Atty. Hertz-McGrath.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 8. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 6-10-15 @ 8:30am. Bond continued.
